title: 111_s1680
content: The Act titled "Expanding Access to Medical Records Act" allows authorized representatives of deceased Medicare beneficiaries full access to Medicare information. The Act "Expanding Access to Medical Records Act" grants authorized representatives of deceased Medicare beneficiaries access to all information regarding the individual's benefits under Medicare, including coverage, billing, claims, and payment details. Authorized representatives also have access to federal government information sources related to these benefits. The Act grants authorized representatives access to information on Medicare benefits, including online databases. An authorized representative is defined as someone with the authority to act on behalf of the deceased individual, determined by the Secretary. The Secretary establishes procedures for determining authorized representatives. The Secretary determines the legal authority of an individual to act on behalf of a deceased person, with a timeline of 30 days for the decision. The individual is notified of the determination within 7 days, granting access to information on Medicare benefits. The amendment allows the authorized representative of a deceased individual access to information and sources related to Medicare benefits within 60 days of enactment. The amendment grants full access to Medicaid information by the authorized representative of a deceased beneficiary. The amendment allows the authorized representative of a deceased Medicaid beneficiary to access all information regarding the individual's benefits, including coverage, billing, claims, and payment details. The amendment allows the authorized representative of a deceased Medicaid beneficiary to access online databases for information on benefits, with the definition of an authorized representative clarified by the State Medicaid agency. The State Medicaid Agency requires evidence of legal authority to act on behalf of a deceased individual, with a 30-day timeline for determination. Notification of the determination must be provided to the individual within 7 days. The State Medicaid Agency must determine the authorized representative of a deceased individual promptly and provide them with necessary information and access to relevant sources. The term 'State Medicaid Agency' refers to the state agency responsible for administering the State plan or any waiver. The amendment made by this section will take effect on a specified date. The amendment made by this section will take effect 60 days after the enactment of the Act. If a State plan requires legislation to meet the new requirements, it will not be considered non-compliant solely for failing to meet these requirements before the first day of the first calendar quarter after the State legislature's session following the Act's enactment. In the case of a State with a 2-year legislative session, each year is considered a separate regular session of the State legislature.
